alert.note: Alert for Clark; Fayette (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 8:44PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Clark and east central Fayette Counties through 915 PM EDT... At 843 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm producing a cold air funnel near Cadentown, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Cold air funnel and wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... East Lexington and Winchester. LANDSPOUT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
